analyzed: jātaka  eka ka nipāta  ka kaṇṭaka vagga
translated: The Jātaka🔽The Collection of Long Discourses🔽The Chapter on Thorns
“You who are not a brahmin, Jātavedas,
we worship you with these sticks of wood;
Today there is no meat for the flesh-eater,
so please accept this crow’s foot.”
The Jātaka of the Crow, the fourth.
